meanings.definition: The baleen plates of a whale used for filtering food from water.
meanings.sent1: The whalebones helped the whale filter its food efficiently.
meanings.sent2: She marveled at the beauty of the intricate whalebones displayed in the museum.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous seagull tried to use the whalebones as a makeshift umbrella during the storm.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was as strong as the sturdy whalebones supporting the massive creature.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight glinted off the smooth surface of the whalebones, creating a mesmerizing sight.

meanings.definition: A material made from whalebone, used historically in corsets and other stiffening garments.
meanings.sent1: The tailor carefully sewed the whalebone into the corset for added support.
meanings.sent2: In the olden days, whalebone was a popular choice for creating rigid structures in clothing.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat batted at the whalebone, mistaking it for a toy.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed was as unyielding as the whalebone in her bodice.
meanings.sent5: The whalebone added a touch of elegance and structure to the flowing gown.
